title: King Charles gets his first Trooping the Colour. Here’s what to know.
description: Britain is celebrating the official birthday of King Charles III on Saturday with a military parade.

title: With African leaders visiting Ukraine, Russia fires missiles at Kyiv
description: African leaders are visiting Ukraine and Russia to push a proposal for halting Russia's war in Ukraine, but arrived in Kyiv on Friday to a major missile attack.

title: Spotify, Prince Harry and Meghan end podcast deal after one season
description: The first episode of Meghan's Archetypes podcast topped Spotify's podcast charts in August 2022. The company says the two sides "have mutually agreed to part ways."

title: China’s grudging welcome to Blinken: It’s all about the economy
description: Secretary of State Anthony Blinken is heading to Beijing. Expectations are low, but analysts say it's good that China and the United States are talking again.

title: Maple syrup or meth? Police find drugs disguised as Canadian export.
description: The police have foiled a plot to smuggle $156 million worth of methamphetamine from Canada to New Zealand via maple syrup containers.

title: Ukraine live briefing: NATO officials meet as Ukraine claims small counteroffensive gains
description: Gen. Mark A. Milley, chairman of the U.S. Joint Chiefs of Staff, predicted the counteroffensive will require “a considerable amount of time" and come at a high cost.

title: Japan (finally) changes a century-old law: The age of consent is now 16
description: Politicians increased the age limit amid an overhaul of sex-crimes laws, but advocates of stricter legislation say more is needed to protect women and girls.

title: How the world is getting more equal — and unequal — at the same time
description: Inequality by many measures is getting worse. But income disparity between all citizens of the world, adjusted for differences in prices between countries, has been falling for decades, economist Branko Milanovic argues.

title: 15 dead after bus with senior citizens collides with semi-trailer in Canada
description: At least 15 people died in Canada after a semi-trailer collided with a bus carrying senior citizens, marking one of the deadliest road accidents in the country’s recent history.
